page.title: 14Wheatley Hill Church
page.content: The church was built in 1873 by members of the{Church of England. }It was built on land which was owned by the{Wilkinson familly.}The church is not dedicated to any particular saint and is called {'All Saints'}church. All Saints church has no tower and no steeple so the symbol on a map is just a black cross. The Vicar, Rev.Thomas Thubron reports that the church is in a good state of repair although the roof needs slight attention. The{chancel}was erected in{1900. The{sanctuary}was built in{1952,} an extension to the{South aisle}was built in {1954,}and a new{Vestry}was completed in {1958.} In all eight people work in the church including the Vicar, organist, church wardens and church council.
